Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: kath91982
Reviews.Content: I was here for three nights in April. I am not sure why it has so many great reviews, but here is what I experienced: 1. There seemed to be only two people working here who spoke any English, but not well! There was rarely an English speaking person around when I needed one (morning, evening) as the English speaking staff was only around during the day I guess. When they were around they did not understand anything I was saying. 2. LOUD. There is construction going on outside the hotel now. Not just during the day or in the morning. ALL NIGHT. The first two nights they were jack-hammering from 1am-4am directly outside my window. Any other time of day you can hear every pin drop from the rooms next to you and even whispered conversations going on outside. The entrance to the hotel is also torn up so you have to go through a side entrance. 3. The room was ok, on the small side even for Europe. You can tell its an old building and things have been done to make it look good on the surface, but there was some deterioration. If the service had been good, this would not have been an issue for me, but after the other negatives it was just too much. 4. The service was not so good. No one seemed willing to help or give any advice aside from trying to force you to eat at the restaurant on the top floor. When it was time for me to get a cab to the airport, the manager simply pointed down the street. I also booked a tour with them which was a complete disaster as I was picked up an hour late, and then taken on the wrong tour. I realized this immediately so was able to tell the guy before he left, but then he put me in a cab and took me to what he said was the correct tour. This ended up being the wrong one as well, but I didnt realize it until we were on the road and it was too late. What a waste of a day! It could be the fault of the tour company, but either way, do not let the hotel book anything for you!!! 5. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It is situated just about a block from the entrance of the Topkapi Palace and behind the Hagia Sophia. There are a ton of other hotels in this area too. If this one had not been so cheap at the last minute I would have been much more upset and given it only one or two stars.

Reviews.Title: “La mia vacanza magica!”
Reviews.Author: nadia b
Reviews.Content: The entire staying in Hotel Megara Palace Istanbul was like a dream. In the hotel is a unique atmosphere. Is beautifully decorated with angels and with antiques things. The reception staff are multilingual and extremely helpful, courteous and very friendly, the services was great. There is a lovely terrace with wonderful sea view. Great experience at a great hotel! I will gladly return soon. With all my love. Nadia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Monica N
Reviews.Content: My name is Monica and i stayed with my friend at the Megara Palace for 2 nights.The location is excellent for short vacations too.Situated in the historical center is very easy to visit to get to the Blue Mosque and to Aya Sophya Museum. The personnel is very heplfull and nice.Breakfast was various and the view from the terrace during breakfast wanderful. I would recommended to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Megara Palace - Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Lakshmy K
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank the owner and all the staff of Megara Palace for making our trip to Istanbul a wonderful and memorable one. We stayed in Megara for 6 nights and 7 days and it was truly a great experience. The location of the Hotel is excellent as some of must see places of historic importance is at a walk-able distance and there is public transport easily available to go around the city.The rooms are small but cosy and the staff at Megara always made us feel at home.Everyday when we returned to the Hotel after a hectic tour and sightseeing day we were always given a warm welcome by the staff of Megara. We truly had a lovely stay.....We recommend Megara!! :) Kesav and Lakshmy - Dubai

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Mauro B
Reviews.Content: I visited Megara for the first time 2 years ago. Since then it has become my point of reference in Istanbul. It is a small hotel in the historical centre, with a great helpful staff and nice clean rooms. Every two months i come back with pleasure! In short, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but on a bad street”
Reviews.Author: Blurgeshmurg
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were quite happy with this hotel - very helpful staff, nice atmosphere, and a pleasant room. Not luxury, but a decent 3-star with nice local flavour and a great breakfast. My only negative (and I feel bad for saying it since they can't help it) is that their street is undergoing major construction. To walk to the hotel, you have to go a bit outside the well-lit and well-populated Sultanahmet hotel cluster, and take a precarious sidewalk. It's just for 30 yards or so, but a woman alone may feel uncomfortable. Once the street construction is done this will be a great budget choice, and even now, it's great value at the 50 Euros or so we paid (in low season).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Elliendyl
Reviews.Content: Everything about megara was perfect, from the location to the staff (ali, chahine, mazloum and the others) to the room decoration to the extraordinary "jacoob", i would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with very personal service!”
Reviews.Author: Sue B
Reviews.Content: Lovely historic hotel very convenient to old city attractions. Staff was excellent, food very good and hotel clean. Gracious hospitality. We would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms were a bit small for money.”
Reviews.Author: Xpec8tor
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good location, interesting sites n restaurants are at walking distance but must take taxy to west side for proper night life. Rooms were small but cozy. Although located on a busy street, the noise was not unpleasant. I would of have liked something roomier for the money. A/C was an unit but worked well, and there was no elevator up to 3rd floor but the outdoor view from the terraced restaurant was worth the effort. Menu for breakfast consisted of traditional Turkish meals that was just enough.Personel were friendly. I would use this hotel again because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, good location but not a very liberal guest policy”
Reviews.Author: crackup51
Reviews.Content: I was on the third floor, and the room was clean and bathroom nice, this is an average hotel, nice free internet, some of the staff are very nice others not so much, not rude, just disinterested. There was a sewage smell that came and went. But the room itself was ok, and bed comfortable. Breakfast was hardly anything, but for what you pay its not bad!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: izabel p
Reviews.Content: Our room was lovely and large. The lighting was good. The bathroom was excellent, they worked well and gave plenty of privacy. the food at the restaurant menu is fresh and delicious.and reception are most helpful and courteous . The service was perfect. Quick responses to requests. The location was good for restaurants in the area and sightseeing. Definitely the best hotel in the old part of town.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: jessie a
Reviews.Content: hotel was wonderfull. especially,staffs were great.Mehmet(he is reception) is very lovely..he is facilitate all the time about everything.the chef at the restaurant is cooking great. when you go to the Megara Palce,you will fell comfortable yourself.... I hope See you Againg Megara Palace...

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: NELSAGirona
Reviews.Content: Along with a good friend ,we decided to share some days off in the beautiful city of Istambul.. We trusted the comments of Trip Advisor and we booked at Megara Palace... Frankly speaking whenever I will travel back to this amazing city ( and I want to repeat soon!!!) I will not hesitate in my choice for a hotel... Megara is a cozy,simple and clean hotel,with a great staff always kind and cooperative... The location is simply wonderful..just a short walk ahead we are in Topkapi ,and Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque,the Basilica Cistern,even the Bazaar are not very far.... A wonderful location indeed..Moreover..unforgettable memories from the view from the terrace...In a fresh december,nothing feels better than sitting close to a fire place,just watching at the Marmara Sea... In general...I recomend this hotel and I hope to stay again there in further visits to Istambul...

Reviews.Title: “A FANTASTIC STAFF!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AMMChicago_Illinois
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights at this hotel. It is an old building with lots of character but the best part of the hotel is the staff. They all went out of their way to make me feel welcome!! Especially Mehmet Asal. He is one of the managers and I wish he worked in every hotel in which I have stayed. He and his staff, notably Nilufer and Mazlum bent over backwards to ensure that my stay there was comfortable. A very special thanks to Mehmet and the staff!!! If I return to Istanbul, I will definitely go back to the Megara Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotell for visting old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: chaekb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located perfect just some hundreds meters from Topkapi, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosc and cisterna. Very friendly and helpful staff. Nice breakfastbuffÃ©. Bathroom is clean. Good small room. Lovely wiew from the restaurant over Marmara sea.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with best atmosphere in splendid location”
Reviews.Author: Adrian S
Reviews.Content: I've been there couple of days. You'll find no other hostel situated in such a good location! 5 minutes is enough to reach Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace. Aya sofya etc. from this place. Apart from that, rooms are very clean, atmosphere in the hotel - friendly. I'll recomend it for everyone wanting to spend nice time in Istanbul in close surrounding of oldest part of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Memories of Megara”
Reviews.Author: drsunilnaik
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at this cosy hotel in Nov 1st week.The small to medium size of the room is easily compensated by it`s central location & warm hospitality of the staff. Though all major tourist spots r at walking distance it njoys the quiet environs. The staff is cooperative.The desk managers know English.I must thank Mr. Mehmood who was always receptive & went out of the way to help us. We thoroughly njoyed our breakfast on the roof terrace. The warmth achieved by a burning fire in the fire place was a great welcome in cool winter.Fresh apricot jam was mouth watering.But i wish daily change in the menu would be desirable. The best part of the hotel which my daughter loved the most was the talkative parrot in the reception lobby. In all we felt homely in Megara.

Reviews.Title: “First class hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Daniel B
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at this small hotel and we were immediately impressed by the genuine and sincerely warm welcome. It got cold at night while we were there (just a week or two ago), and the desk clerk always invited us to sit down in the lobby and have some hot tea with him. One of us had the misfortune of having the airline lose a suitcase, and the kind folks here were all over it: they contacted Air France regularly to see if the lost piece had been found, and when it arrived, they took it immediately to its owner's room. The hotel is well located, convenient to the top tourist sites. It was a relief to know that after spending hours on our feet that we could even go back to this hotel for a brief nap before heading out again. Yes, the rooms are kind of small. Yes, there are no frills. But the friendly staff and the location make up for all of that. I'd recommend this to anybody, and what's more, if I ever visit Istanbul again, I'll most definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great and comfort hotel near Istabul's top sights”
Reviews.Author: Esko_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for 4 nights in October 2011. The hotel was comfort. Room was small but it was clean & very comfortable with very freindliest and kind staffs. The highlight being the roof terrace with amazing views over the city and of the sea. Great way to start the day over breakfast. Free Wi-Fi in the hotel is a good idea. Hotel was located very close to all sights in the Old City. You are fantastically close to some of the main sights, and it felt very safe to wander around at night. We would recommend this hotel for its location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “When your a woman travelling alone its so nice to feel at home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JEL13
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 days in October 2011. The hotel has a lovely energy, which is very important to me. Of course the location, decor and service are also important, and were a very good standard indeed. The highlight being the roof terrace with amazing views over the city and of the sea. Great way to start the day over breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Abdullah D, London - great location is old city”
Reviews.Author: abdullahDLondon
Reviews.Content: hotel located very close to all sights in the Old City. breakfast is good with great view from rooftop. room are small but it is clean & very comfortable with very freindliest and kind staffs Ali, Mehmet, etc.I recommend to any one who want to stay in the Old City.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel, in top city!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nageeb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just literally walked through the Front door of our home after having spent 6 nights at the Megara Palace Hotel. this hotel is a beautiful hotel, with the friendliest and kindest staff we have had the pleasure meeting especially the reception staff Ali, Mehmet, Farhan and Khalil in the restaurant. The staff made us feel very welcome and gave us many tips and ideas advised us about where to go and The hotel is well located to be able to reach the majority of tourist sites, restaurants and shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Old City Sights”
Reviews.Author: MatthewP P
Reviews.Content: Best thing was the breakfast - all you can eat and a great variety. Room was small but very clean, staff helpful but not intrusive, quiet location but really close to all the old city sights. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. However one thing that might put some people off, but suit others well is that you are in a heritage and tourist part of town. You are fantastically close to some of the main sights, and it felt very safe to wander around at night, but all the restaurants and shops in the vicinity are very tourist orientated. If you want a more local feel, or buzzing local night life then consider somewhere like Taksim across the river. We arranged an airport pickup and drop off - it was 10 Euros per person for pick up and only 5 for return - I don't know why there was a price difference, but all went smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with spectacular rooftop view”
Reviews.Author: MkgCentralNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Small but comfortable boutique hotel in a great location of the old town, right up the street from the Topkapi palace and just a few minutes to the main square by the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Staff was very friendly and helpful. They took care of handling our airport transfers and booking a very special restaurant for a birthday celebration. Hotel's rooftop restaurant served a delightful breakfast with outdoor seating on the terrace overlooking the Bosphorus. Free Wi-Fi. The rooms were clean and well maintained and the staff was extremely nice.

Reviews.Title: “A Turkish delight”
Reviews.Author: Gemfish
Reviews.Content: For our first visit to Istanbul, my partner and I chose to stay at the Megara Palace Hotel based on the TripAdvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. The hotel is close to the main sights in the Sultanahmet District including the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Aya Sofya Museum. We found both the bedroom and bathroom in room 306 small, but for the price, we understood that we were not booking a suite. The bed was comfortable and staff obliging when we requested two additional pillows. Furnishings were traditional with charm. The room was cleaned immaculately every day. The staff were pleasant and helpful. One exception was when I asked for a plug for the sink. I was informed that plugs were not used in Turkey and none was forthcoming. To think, thousands of years of civilization and the Turks havenâ€™t discovered the utility of the sink plug! Breakfast included a wide choice, though for our nine nightsâ€™ stay it was repetitive. Some variation in the offering would be better, but we understand that most guests would probably stay for a shorter period. Thanks, Shahin, for your smiling face every morning. There was quite a lot of tourist bus traffic past the hotel during the day but never any disturbance at night. The 6am call to prayer from the small historic mosque across the road was to be expected in a Muslim country and was very short. Be aware that no one who has difficulty climbing stairs would be able to access the breakfast restaurant on the 5th floor roof terrace. There are some ground-floor rooms but no lift. Our cases were carried up and down the curved staircase for us, thankfully. It is only a short walk to the Sultanahmet tram stop for trips further afield. I certainly recommend purchasing an Istanbulkart that makes using the trams, metro, ferries and funicular easy. Topping up is easy at one of the machines at many boarding points. These have instructions in Turkish or English. Read our review of the Khorasani Restaurant for the best place to eat in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelProNewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night before coming back to home. What the price you pay, this hotel is a great choice. Had a room with terrace that was very nice to see the view and feel outside air. But you have to walk up 4 floors. Room and bathroom is small, but no complain as it was expected.It was clean and nice decor. Don't expect major hotel chain brand quality. Excellent location for touring old city on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Inna M
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, very close to Topkapi Palace and Aya Sofia. The hotel staff is very welcoming and accommodating. We enjoyed outdoor breakfast on the hotel terrace with amazing view.We wil recommend this hotel to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel to explore Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Gergana T
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful hotel if your goal is to explore the treasures and wonders of the historical part of Istanbul. Cannot think of a better location - behind the Saint Sofia Museum and facing the walls of the Topkapi Palace - a marvelous and calm place to give your tired feet some rest and to start exploring again Istanbul the next day.... Say "Hallo" to the parrot in the lobby, greet the helpful receptionists and head for a drink on the roof tarrace - the Bosphorus spreading before your eyes - this is my perception of a real Istanbul experience. I really loved the place and so did my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Megara Palace Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Marie V
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in Istanbul for holiday. The location is superb, really close to Topkapi Palace and Aya Sofya. The hotel is clean and comfortable. The terrace for breakfast has amazing view. Receptionist Ferhan has been very accommodating and friendly especially to me as a solo traveler. Overall I am happy with my stay in Megara. Very good price for excellent value!! highly recommended especially for first timer who is not familiar with tourist location in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “thanks megara palace”
Reviews.Author: jemka1969
Reviews.Content: thank you for making myself and my girlfriend very comfortable whilst there for 5 nights. hope to see you soon and thanks to your lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View and Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Marcel Z
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Megara Palace Hotel from 18th to 20th September 2011 with the beautiful view of the Bosphorus Sea from our Balcony. The Front Office Manager Mr. Mehmet Asal was very helpful and extended excellent service on our arrival which is very commendable. He ensures that all guests are happy. We were pleased with the excellent services extended by Mr. Mehmet and his staff. Best wishes to Mr. Mehmet and the Megara Hotel From : Marcel, Odette & Shawn Zuzarte - Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LauraTejedor
Reviews.Content: We have spent 5 nights in Megara Palace and besides having the best location in Istanbul for visiting all the tourist places is a quiet hotel where you can rest very comfortable after a hard day walking around. You should not miss the fantastic terrace near by the bar where you can have a drink looking at Bosphorus. If you want to have the complete experience buy the CD of Seda Bagcan in the lobby and you will go back home absolutely relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “My best Choice”
Reviews.Author: rio6760
Reviews.Content: It was my best choice to stay in Megara Palace. I am Korean. Mr. Mehmet asal and all manager were very kind to me. The view on the top floor of Megara was very nice.Restaurant was on the top floor and Breakfast was very very delicious. I can`t forget kindness of Megara Family. Very Good for me !!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique-style hotel”
Reviews.Author: dgrierson
Reviews.Content: I certainly had no complaints. The rooms were clean and neat and tidy, and the staff were friendly and most helpful. I really have no faults to report. I regret that we did not have the opportunity to eat at your restaurant, so I cannot comment on that, but the view from the roof would add to any dining experience. What is so great about the hotel is the locality: it is within walking distance of the major attractions in the Old City. What is also great is that it is just off the main â€œnight-lifeâ€� street, thus making it quiet, but accessible. I thank you and your staff again for a wonderful stay. Keep looking after those plants on the sidewalk â€“ they are an asset to the appearance of the hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel accommodation and Resturant”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: My travel agent booked me into Megara Palace for 7 nights September 2011. This is a small Hotel if 20 well appointed rooms. Its location is central to Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque - all within a 5 minute walk and a 7 minute walk to the tram. The best part of the Hotel is its staff who are professional but go out of their way to assist and welcome. A real tribute to a good team. Breakfast is served in a roof top garden with stunning views over the Mamara Sea where one could spend all day watching the ships enter and exit the Bosphorous. The food at breakfast is fresh and interesting - all diets are catered for. But nighttime, is a rare find and again in the roof garden - the most delicious and tasty Turkish dishes are cooked and served. I would highly recommend this Hotel for its centrality, a helpful staff and good old fashioned service orientated staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Christinemayberry
Reviews.Content: Quaint hotel in the heart of everything you need to see. Turkish people are lovely and the staff here are no exception. Nothing is too much trouble for them. It was a pleasure to return to the hotel each day after exploring the city. The rooftop is a lovely place to have coffee and the breakfast was delicious and substantial. Very good value and a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but dont expect much from the service”
Reviews.Author: aussy-blonde
Reviews.Content: We stayed on two occassions during our trip to Turkey and overall were pleased with the hotel. Advantages: great location - walking distance to everything & close to tram station, clean rooms well furnished and adequate space, breakast was good by Turkish standards, hotel restaraunt was really good food, credit cards taken which we found out is somewhat of a rareity in most turkish hotels. Disadvantages: staff were helpful but came across a little cold, walls are thin, shower was a good temp but need new shower heads as water comes out drizzling in all directions, worst of all was being woken up every morning at 4.30 when the mosque next door sounded the call to prayer.

Reviews.Title: “a disgrace”
Reviews.Author: hennievanwijk
Reviews.Content: ...we booked a wheelchairroom with written confirmation, they had none...breakfastroom on the 4th floor but no elevator...day 2 we found our luggage and my notebook in the hallway unattended, we checked out right away...no apologies, nothing

Reviews.Title: “I am Loving it !”
Reviews.Author: Eone1505
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 3 different hotels throughout our stay in Istanbul and Kapadokya, and Megara Palace was the best. Value for money and the staff were very friendly including the Mgr, Mr Mehmet. Even the staff who in-charged of the dining restaurant was very friendly and helpful. If I stay in Sultan Ahmet area, definitely I will stay at the hotel again :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kurtlubulgur
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel and i can sincerely say that, this hotel is the most charming quiet hotel i've ever seen. Hotel has good staff, clean rooms and very nice landscape. prices are not expensive as other hotels around. Even if i live in Istanbul, sometimes i have peace of mind here and walk away from troubles of this crowded city.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, quiet area”
Reviews.Author: LogT
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights on this small but cosy hotel. The location is perfect, with the three big sights with in close walking distance. Breakfast was as good as a turkish breakfast can be, but probably even better during warmer weather, due to the beutiful view from the roof terrace. All though the hotel is located at the end of "backpacker street" it were a quiet location whith very little traffic outside. With helpful staff at hand 24/7, the stay felt safe and comfortable. No doubt, when we're coming back to Istanbul, Megara Palace will see us as their guests again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel literally near the Topkapi walls”
Reviews.Author: MDL2a
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a great location: right near the Topkapi walls, 3 minutes walk to Hagia Sofia. The rooms are very nicely furnished and clean. The staff is very helpful and very nice. The breakfast does not offer a very wide selection, but the roof top view and the strong turkish tea are worth it. Best feature: breakafast area. Not so good feature: none really... :) except if you are big on breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with service-oriented staff”
Reviews.Author: leenanpostilaatikko
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my friend. The hotel is very well located regarding the most popular sightseeing. However the hotel is very quiet so sleeping wont be disturbed. Staff is very nice and helpful, and the hotel is clean. Specially I have to mention the food- it is superb; and the view from restaurant is also worth seeing. Rooms are a bit small so don't take too much luggage. Also there are stairs, so maybe not the best place for people with poor feet. If I ever visit Istanbul again, I definitely will go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well pleased”
Reviews.Author: hinau
Reviews.Content: Pleased with the quality for the money. It was well located, with nice outlook , quiet, good amentities, helpful staff, good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: baile
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Megara Palace over the Easter weekend. I recommend it as offering acceptable value for the price. The hotel is clean and secure with a small lobby/reception area. The staff are a major selling point of the hotel. They were always professional, nice & helpfull (and don't forget the parrot). If you don't expect the Four Seasons, you won't be disappointed. In most hotels, single rooms are small, and not the most attractive rooms & Megara was no different. The single rooms are tiny, but they kindly moved me to a higher floor which was less dungeon-like but still no view. The decor was dark but the room clean. The bathroom seemed larger than the room itself, there was an odor in the bathroom at first, but they worked on getting rid of it. Also there was a problem with the TV and it was replaced. I peeked into vacant double rooms and they were small but brighter etc. Breakfast is very basic but you won't starve and the terrace was nice with a view. there is no elevator and the stairs are quirky but the staff will carry luggage etc. Location is good, opposite to Topkapi Palace and short walk to Hagia Sophia & Blue Mosque. The Four Seasons Hotel is around the corner and there are loads of restaurants nearby. The tram was only a short walk away. The hotel's easier to reach on foot as there are lots of little, one way streets and the two taxis I took had great trouble finding the hotel. Once I was familiar with the area I thought it a fine location. I would stay again for the price, but would ask that the hotel consider upgrading the single rooms. I'd recommend to someone looking for just above basic accommodations. I loved Istanbul but didn't get to see enough. Aside from the highspots, I'd recommend 1) the sightseeing bus tour as it gives a good overall view; 2) a boat trip, even the shorter ones are worth it; 3) Just sitting, having tea and watching the world pass by was enjoyable and an education.

Reviews.Title: “nice tucked away hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sheila567
Reviews.Content: this hotel was alright.. i was expecting more but it was fine. i arrived here and was given my room, the bed was comfortable. but the rooms are incredibly small, but the bathroom was really nice! the shower was strong and the toilet was nice. i woke up nicely, and there was no traffic noise. i headed up stairs in the morning for breakfast, and it really does have a panoramic view, the view, you could just stare at forever, you could see the ocean, and i took loads of pictures. it was really warm sitting outside eating breakfast, and this annoying ginger car kept walking past us. the waiter was helpful. the food was rubbish. it was really basic. it had pieces of baguette chopped up, and all fruit, and im not a fruit person, so , but they had nice pieces of chocolate. and the tea was nice. the hotel was in the best possible location, it was right outside the topkapi palace, and walking distance to the blue mosque. sitting outside there at night was really nice, and relaxing though you get a lot of beggars and cats following you. just threaten them by saying police and they run off- both of them. the reception staff were really nice, they helped us , and told us where to visit and the best times of day to go, they gave us a map, the rooms were really clean but were small. i wouldnt come back to this hotel since the rooms are really small and i dont like that. another bad thing is that the stairs are really small and dangerous, they twist as you go up, and they dont have elevators, so thats one bad thing. Overall, a good hotel, with friendly staff and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Encantador hotel de familia.”
Reviews.Author: lrazetow
Reviews.Content: Hello Megara Palace Hotel Team : We remember you very much, also our stay at the lovely Istambul and the time we spent at your hotel. The good food and the beautiful views of the Bosforo from the restaurant, we will never forget. We are having rough time at Chile now, because of the earthquake and tsunami of some days ago. Nothing bad happened to us or to our house, but some cities at the south of the country are complete destroyed. Thanks you again for the nice time we spent at the Megara Hotel. Hope we shall see you again. Razeto family from CHILE.

Reviews.Title: “A Place with good taste and good vibes with best location”
Reviews.Author: vagabonda10
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully located Topkapi, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque behind corner, trams as well and bazaars also with walking sitance if one like walking. New modern shower cabins and we had splended view as well.Taxi station opposite the entrance. Friendly service minded staff, a nice parrot Jacob who speaks several languages amazingly also Finnish. The price and quality - excellent! Also you get good advice from reception what to do her to go and how to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, warm atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: dyana_georgescu
Reviews.Content: Although initially we had booked a room in Megara Hotel, for a weekend, due to some changes in room availability, we have been checked in Megara Palace, a few steps away from the initial hotel. Anyway, they made a good choice, as the location was great, we could see the Bosphorus in the morning when we were having breakfast on the terrace. They had a funny fluffy cat, as the hotel's pet, which would often come in the mornings at the tourists' windows and look inside their rooms. A nice double room, with dark floor and smooth bedsheets, and also the painting on the wall in our room has been very inspiring for a young couple who was there for a romantic weekend :)

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: larocka
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting istanbul for the last 5 to 6 years and have always found the standard of accomodation very high. This was our first time at the Megara Palace and we will definately be returning , the hotel and rooms are excellent , very friendly and helpfull staff.Brilliant roof top terrace retaurant, The location is perfect close to cultural sites and great restaurants and bars. Malcolm and Ziggy

Reviews.Title: “Location,friendly staff & character of hotel”
Reviews.Author: HorseBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Fantastic view to the sea and city.The staff were always obliging and the location, right in the heart of old Istanbul(Sultanhamet) tourist area.Great for a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: woodwolf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Megara Palace while we were in Istanbul visiting our son. We found the hotel clean and the bed was very comfortable. We had a room on the fourth floor and it had a balcony with a great view (you must use stairs). The breakfast is traditional Turkish and the terrace is great. The hotel staff was friendly and spoke excellent English on the day shift. If you arrange transportation from the hotel (which works very well) be sure to pay separately, they cannot put this on your bill. The location is simply perfect, close to everything and we felt totally safe walking about in the evening. There are many excellent restaurants nearby, our favorite was Rumist. Enjoy Istanbul, I have been there twice and hope to return soon. Ali is great and so it Tijen, they will do everything possible to make your stay perfect. The free internet is excellent, fast and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “good location & excellent rooftop breakfast, but a bit smelly”
Reviews.Author: q2435V34
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in early June 2009. We are a young American couple who was in Istanbul to do a lot of sightseeing. Since we were on a budget, we were also looking for a Sultanahmet-area hotel for less than 100 USD. We booked Megara Palace through Expedia for roughly 70 USD per night and got a good sized double (bath ensuite) with a nice view. The room was clean and comfortable, and we had no complaints with the room itself. The hotel itself has a kind of dark, medieval look to it---with a stone staircase and very dark paneling in the hallways. The owners keep a neat pet bird in the lobby; it can say basic things in a variety of different languages ("Hello!", "Bonjour!", "Meow!"). One of the main perks of the hotel is the location. It's about a two minute walk up to the entrance of the Topkapi Palace, and about an extra three minutes to the Blue Mosque. Another huge perk is the nice breakfast on the rooftop with great views of the Bosphorous. On a sunny cool morning, it's the best way to start a day of sightseeing. The breakfast server is also nice and charming. The breakfast and view were our favorite parts of the hotel. Oh, and we also appreciated the free WiFi access from our room! On the flip side, the downside of the hotel is that it's a bit smelly. The room itself smelled fine, but the rest of the hotel smelled unmistakably like animal urine. We suspected the bird in the lobby, but it might also have been the feral cats that we occasionally saw lurking about. It wasn't a huge deal, but it does color your impression of the hotel when you walk in. Overall, though, we'd likely stay again or recommend the hotel to our budget-minded friends. The location and price are good, and it's a clean and convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A homely hotel, perfectly positioned and good value.”
Reviews.Author: phyper1
Reviews.Content: Ali, thank you for making myself and my wife very comfortable whilst there for 3 nights. We arrived early morning, about 07.00 h., after a long tiring coach journey and though check-in time is towards mid-day, we were very pleasantly surprised and tremendously thankful to be allowed into our allocated room so early. That made the difference to us, between a hotel with 'strictly business' and a hotel with 'personal touch'. We did not have to wait for hours, either sitting in a cafe or out on the streets, waiting for the hour of check-in. Excellent service from the staff, polite and obliging and you even get greeted by the papagalos. The Hotel is practically outside the entrance to the Topkapi and at the side of Ayia Sofia. What a great pleasure to finish your walks in the extensive Topkapi complex and then, 50 metres away, you have a nice hot shower to go under. Bliss. And then start again fresh. No long walks, or taxi rides, to Sultanahmet square, the hub of the razzle-dazzle of the district.. Yes, the rooms are rather basic, not enough hungers in the wardrobe, just 3 and no chairs either to sit on or put your clothes on at night (Not all rooms are so, Ali said). Ask Ali for those items when you are there, he will oblige. The bed and beddings were good and clean and the bathroom larger than necessary, at the expense of the bedroom. There is a working air-condition unit in the room, just switch on. The nights were a bit chilly, but Ali turned the CH on for us at the asking. It gets a bit noisy from early morning, with all the taxis lined up outside and cars going up the slight hill, but bearable. And if you want restaurants gallore, just walk 30 metres down and you are in the midst of the road with the 10's of all types of restaurants with their tables lining the street. Yes, if in Istanbul, I will go again to the Megara Palace. ARIF!!!! DO NOT marry that girl. !!!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel with nice people & location”
Reviews.Author: TH_BXL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, the view from the rooms and the breakfast room is beautiful, and the employees are nice and helpful. This is a good hotel for Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely go back there...”
Reviews.Author: AnkitaNorthampton_UK
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the hotel was very close to the Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia and the Blus Mosque. I really liked the roof terrace where we had our breakfast in the morning overlooking the lovely views of Istanbul. There were many restaurants near by which all did delicious local cuisines. Istanbul is a wonderful city and I would love to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Great Staff (Ferhan)”
Reviews.Author: cdenizyildiz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is completely close to many Interesting places. We were for 3 nifghts at the Megara. it was really wonderfull. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The management and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. we want to say to the Ferhan once again THANK YOU!!! WE WILL COME AGAIN. Alpi, Aydin, Deniz, Dogan, Turgay

HotelInfo.Name: Megara Palace
HotelInfo.Address: Ishakpasa Cad. 8, Istanbul 34140, Turkey
